description: a(-1)=1 by convention; for n >= 0, a(n) = number of irreducible Boolean functions of n variables.
comments: Number of NP-equivalence classes of switching functions of n or fewer variables.Number of inequivalent binary nonlinear codes of length n (and all sizes).a(n+1) = number of NPN-equivalence classes of canalizing functions (see A102449) with n variables. NPN-equivalence allows complementing the function value as well as the individual variables. E.g., the 6 inequivalent canalizing functions when n=3 are 0, x, x AND y, x AND y AND z, x AND (y OR z), x AND (y XOR z). - _Don Knuth_, Aug 24 2005, Aug 06 2006
references: F. Harary and E. M. Palmer, Graphical Enumeration, Academic Press, NY, 1973, p. 112.

formula: Harrison gives a simple formula in terms of the cycle index of the appropriate group.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
